chunks.content: O'Hara strongly believed that the Fighting Irish football team could be an effective means to 'acquaint the public with the ideals that dominate' Notre Dame. He wrote, 'Notre Dame football is a spiritual service because it is played for the honor and glory of God and of his Blessed Mother.'

metadata.relevance_reason: This excerpt directly states that Father O'Hara believed the football team played for the honor and glory of God and his Blessed Mother.
metadata.answer_contribution: This provides the specific belief of Father O'Hara regarding the purpose of the football team's play.

required_info: the purpose of the Notre Dame football team's play
